xyz.acygn.mokapot.util

Class ObjectMethodDatabase<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.acygn.mokapot.util.ObjectMethodDatabase<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The actual class of objects described by the database.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SaltedObjectMethodDatabase

    public class ObjectMethodDatabase<T>
extends Object
    A listing of all the methods (and fields, and classes) that exist on objects which have a given actual class. This is useful both for static analysis, and at runtime.
    Author:
    Alex Smith

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ObjectMethodDatabase(Class<T> about)
      Create a database of methods, fields and superclasses/interfaces for objects with the given actual class.

      • ObjectMethodDatabase

        Parameters:
        about - The actual class that the resulting database should be about.

    • Method Detail

      • methodSignature

        public static String methodSignature(Method m)
        Produces a "method signature" for a method. This contains the method's name and argument types, but typically not its declaring class or return type. As an exception, if the method is static, the signature includes its declaring class too (because unlike in the case of an instance method, static methods do not shadow each other). Two methods with the same signature are considered to be identical by this class (as if both exist on the same object, they will do the same thing when called virtually).

        Note that this is not the same concept as a Java method signature or method descriptor, which does not include the method's name.

        Parameters:
        m - The method to calculate the signature of.
        Returns:
        The method's signature.

      • setAccessible

        public void setAccessible()
                   throws SecurityException
        Perform access checks on all the fields and methods stored in this database. If the checks succeed, then the field and method objects returned from getInstanceFieldList and getMethods will be usable from any package regardless of visibility and finality modifiers.
        Throws:
        SecurityException - If an access check fails

      • getAbout

        public Class<T> getAbout()
        Returns the class that is described in this database (that is, the actual class of objects that the database describes).
        Returns:
        T.class

      • getInstanceFieldList

        public Iterable<Field> getInstanceFieldList()
        Produces a list of fields that objects of this class possess. For any given class, its fields will always be returned in the same order, even on different computers or on different runs of the program.

        Bear in mind that this will not contain static fields; those belong to the class, not the object.

        Returns:
        An unmodifiable ordered list of fields.

      • getMethods

        public Set<Method> getMethods()
        Produces a set of methods that objects of this class possess. This will not be in any particular order.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable set of methods.
